screenshots.caption: Early Prototype of ITTAT - second order coding.

name: ITTAT(Qualitative Research Tool)
short_description:
ITTAT (Interview Transcription & Themeatic Analysis Tool):  _________________________________________________
As a Psychology Undergraduate Student I was asked to complete a series of Qualitative Analyses of Interview transcriptions. This is a laborious academic process designed to reveal the themes emerging in the interview. 

The process (broadly) involves adorning text with 'first impression' comments, distilling these into a series of themes which are often color-coded into the text with highlighting. Finally these themes are further distilled into only a few key-themes. 

My University recommended Microsoft Word for this task. However the process of highlighting and commenting large volumes of text is enormously time consuming in MS word. Furthermore MS word is poorly equipped to group or manipulate text based on highlighting.

ITTAT then is a free tool to make the process of highlighting, commenting and thematic grouping of text simple and fast.
